Function.Name: Mapping workflow
Description: Given raw participant-level data, all necessary data.frame transformations are made to create input data for all workflows

Function.Name: Analysis workflow
Description: Given raw participant-level data, a properly specified Workflow for a KRI creates summarized and flagged data

Function.Name: Analysis workflow
Description: Given raw participant-level data with missingness, a properly specified Workflow for a KRI creates summarized and flagged data

Function.Name: Analysis workflow
Description: Given pre-processed input data, a properly specified Workflow for a KRI creates summarized and flagged data

Function.Name: Flag_NormalApprox
Description: Given appropriate metadata (i.e. vThresholds), flagged observations are properly marked in summary data

Function.Name: Analyze_NormalApprox_PredictBounds
Description: Given appropriate metadata (i.e. vThresholds), data.frame of bounds can be created

Function.Name: Summarize
Description: Given appropriate raw participant-level data, flag values can be correctly assigned to records that meet flagging criteria, including custom thresholding.

Function.Name: Summarize
Description: Given appropriate raw participant-level data, flag values are correctly assigned as NA for sites with low enrollment.

Function.Name: Adverse Event Assessment
Description: Given appropriate raw participant-level data, an Adverse Event Assessment can be done using the Normal Approximation method.

Function.Name: Adverse Event Assessment
Description: Adverse Event Assessments can be done correctly using a grouping variable, such as Site or Country for KRIs, and Study for QTLs, when applicable.

Function.Name: Protocol Deviation Assessment
Description: Given appropriate raw participant-level data, a Protocol Deviation Assessment can be done using the Normal Approximation method.

Function.Name: Protocol Deviation Assessment
Description: Protocol Deviation Assessments can be done correctly using a grouping variable, such as Site or Country for KRIs, and Study for QTLs, when applicable.

Description: Given appropriate raw participant-level data, a Dispositon Assessment can be done using the Normal Approximation method.

Description: Disposition Assessments can be done correctly using a grouping variable, such as Site or Country for KRIs, and Study for QTLs, when applicable.

Description: Labs Assessments can be done correctly using a grouping variable, such as Site or Country for KRIs, and Study for QTLs, when applicable.

Description: Data Change Rate Assessments can be done correctly using a grouping variable, such as Site, Country, or Study, when applicable.
